events.originalText: Russia withdraws from the Council of Europe after expulsion procedures were brought for its invasion of Ukraine.
events.subtitle: Russia in the Council of Europe
events.headline: Russia withdraws from Council of Europe over Ukraine invasion

events.originalText: Iraqi authorities hanged Iranian freelance reporter Farzad Bazoft on charges of spying for Israel.
events.subtitle: Farzad Bazoft
events.headline: Iraq hangs Iranian reporter Farzad Bazoft for spying

events.originalText: Transvestism and Transsexuality in Modern Society, the UK's first trans rights conference, opened with an evening reception in Leeds.
events.subtitle: Transvestism and Transsexuality in Modern Society
events.headline: UK's first trans rights conference opens in Leeds

events.originalText: Students from Atlanta University Center, inspired by similar actions in Greensboro, North Carolina, began occupying lunch counters in Atlanta, Georgia.
events.subtitle: Atlanta University Center
events.headline: Atlanta University Center students occupy lunch counters

events.originalText: The musical My Fair Lady, based on George Bernard Shaw's play Pygmalion, debuted at the Mark Hellinger Theatre in New York City.
events.subtitle: My Fair Lady
events.headline: My Fair Lady musical debuts in New York City

events.originalText: The Iranian oil industry was nationalized in a movement led by Mohammad Mosaddegh.
events.subtitle: Nationalization of the Iranian oil industry
events.headline: Iran nationalizes oil industry under Mohammad Mosaddegh

events.originalText: Deportation of 50,000 Jews from the Greek city of Thessaloniki begins.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust in Greece
events.headline: Deportation of 50,000 Jews from Thessaloniki begins

events.originalText: World War II: German forces recaptured Kharkov after four days of house-to-house fighting against Soviet troops, ending the month-long Third Battle of Kharkov.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German forces recapture Kharkov in Third Battle of Kharkov

events.originalText: In rowing, Oxford defeated Cambridge in the inaugural edition of the Women's Boat Race.
events.subtitle: University of Oxford
events.headline: Oxford defeats Cambridge in Women's Boat Race

events.originalText: Talaat Pasha, the main perpetrator of the Armenian genocide, was assassinated by Soghomon Tehlirian.
events.subtitle: Talaat Pasha
events.headline: Talaat Pasha, Armenian genocide perpetrator, assassinated

events.originalText: Russian Revolution: Tsar Nicholas II was forced to abdicate in the February Revolution, ending three centuries of Romanov rule.
events.subtitle: Russian Revolution
events.headline: Tsar Nicholas II forced to abdicate in Russian Revolution

events.originalText: Six days after Pancho Villa and his cross-border raiders attacked Columbus, New Mexico, U.S. General John J. Pershing led a punitive expedition into Mexico to pursue Villa.
events.subtitle: Pancho Villa
events.headline: General Pershing leads expedition into Mexico after Villa raid

events.originalText: Prospectors drilled into a pressurized deposit within the Midway-Sunset Oil Field in California, resulting in the largest accidental oil spill in history, which eventually released 9 million barrels (1.4 million m3) of crude oil over 18 months.
events.subtitle: Midway-Sunset Oil Field
events.headline: Largest oil spill in history at Midway-Sunset Oil Field in California

events.originalText: John McCloskey, the archbishop of New York, was created the first cardinal from the United States.
events.subtitle: John McCloskey
events.headline: John McCloskey becomes first cardinal from the United States

events.originalText: Sailor Benjamin Morrell erroneously reported the existence of the island of New South Greenland near Antarctica.
events.subtitle: Benjamin Morrell
events.headline: Sailor Benjamin Morrell reports nonexistent island near Antarctica

events.originalText: George Washington delivered a speech to Continental Army officers in Newburgh, New York, asking them to support the supremacy of the Congress of the Confederation, defusing a potential coup.
events.subtitle: George Washington
events.headline: George Washington defuses potential coup in Newburgh speech

events.originalText: In the Battle of Halmyros, the Catalan Company defeated the forces of Walter V, Count of Brienne, taking control of the Duchy of Athens, a Crusader state in present-day Greece.
events.subtitle: Battle of Halmyros
events.headline: Catalan Company defeats Walter V in Battle of Halmyros

events.originalText: Reconquista: Portuguese troops under King Afonso I captured the city of Santarém from the Almoravids.
events.subtitle: Reconquista
events.headline: Portuguese troops capture Santarém in Reconquista

events.originalText: Byzantine emperor Michael III (pictured) overthrew the regency of his mother Theodora to assume power for himself.
events.subtitle: Michael III
events.headline: Byzantine emperor Michael III overthrows regency of Theodora

events.originalText: Julius Caesar, the dictator of the Roman Republic, was stabbed to death by a group of senators led by Marcus Junius Brutus.
events.subtitle: Julius Caesar
events.headline: Julius Caesar stabbed to death by senators led by Brutus
